item.title: about me
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: Hi, I'm Zach! I love science and solving problems. I’m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL at Vanderbilt University applying ML to medical and neuroscientific data – mainly brain MRI, endoscopic feeds, fMRI, and EEG. I’m also interested in dimensionality reduction, cyberphysical systems, control theory, optimization, and robotics. Check out my projects to see what I’m working on! GitHub LinkedIn goodreads
item.content:encoded: Hi, I'm Zach! I love science and solving problems. I&rsquo;m currently a graduate student researcher in VISE MedICL at Vanderbilt University applying ML to medical and neuroscientific data &ndash; mainly brain MRI, endoscopic feeds, fMRI, and EEG. I&rsquo;m also interested in dimensionality reduction, cyberphysical systems, control theory, optimization, and robotics. Check out my projects to see what I&rsquo;m working on! GitHub LinkedIn goodreads I graduated from Vandy in May 2021 with a B.S. in computer science and neuroscience, minoring in applied math. I expect to complete my masters in computer science from Vandy in May 2022. My hometown is Austin, TX. Outside of research, I enjoy heavy weights, friendship, hendiadys, esports, kombucha, haiku &amp; senryu, cucumber cocktails, and sunset runs. Occasionally, I take a good photo and write a haiku or senryu to pair with it. I am always open to new opportunities, especially those that align with my interests. You can contact me at zachary.a.stoebner@vanderbilt.edu.
